#Text=2. Aircraft Engine Descriptions and Modeling
#Text=2.1 .
#Text=Engine Descriptions
#Text=A high bypass twin spool mixing-exhaust turbofan engine was studied in this paper , of which the schematic description is shown in
#Text=Figure 2
#Text=.
#Text=The airflow was supplied by a single inlet .
#Text=Airflow passed through the fan and separated into two streams — one passed through engine core path , and the other passed through the bypass duct .
#Text=Fuel was injected in the combustor and burned to produce the hot gas to drive the turbines .
#Text=The fan and low pressure compressor ( LPC ) were driven by a low pressure turbine ( LPT ) , whereas the high pressure compressor ( HPC ) was driven by a high pressure turbine ( HPT ) .
#Text=The airflow left through the nozzle .
#Text=The notations used in this paper and their descriptions are shown in Table 1 .
#Text=Mechanical system dynamics due to rotating inertias constituted the most important contribution to engine transient behavior .
#Text=Thus , rotating dynamics were the most important dynamics to be considered .
#Text=In light of this , the state vector was chosen as .

#Text=Newton ’s law for rotating masses was applied to each shaft as ( 1 ) where f 1 and f 2 are the net torques delivered by LPT and HPT . is the control input and v denotes the external parameters ( flight condition ) .
#Text=Considering air flow mass , power , and momentum conservation laws , a general gas turbine simulation was designed using the concept in .

#Text=The engine design operation data and characteristic maps of rotating components such as fan , compressor , HPT , and LPT were loaded to the general simulation for obtaining a certain turbofan engine model .
#Text=The nonlinear model representing a turbofan engine was given by ( 2 ) where is the output .
#Text=In the engine involved in this paper , the available sensors were The function and are , respectively , the engine process and measurement expressions .
#Text=The engine was coded with C language and packaged by Dynamic Link Library ( DLL ) for simulation in Matlab ( 2016a , MathWorks , Natick , MA , USA ) environment .

#Text=Taylor approximation was applied to the engine model Equation ( 2 ) at the equilibrium point ( , ) , and retaining constant and first-order terms yielded the following state variable model ( SVM ) : ( 3 )
#Text=Equation ( 3 ) can be further depicted as ( 4 ) where , , , and are the system matrices with appropriate dimensions , and , , and .
#Text=For simplicity , the sign “ ” in Equation ( 4 ) was omitted in the following deductions .
#Text=In addition , the quantities of different variables in Equation ( 4 ) were far away from each other .
#Text=For instance , the normal physical quantity of at the design point was about 15,012 r/min , whereas the normal physical value of fuel flow at the design point was around 0.3606 kg/s .

#Text=The large difference in the magnitudes of various model variables would lead to large difference of matrix singular values in the SVM , and it produced a big condition number of the system matrix .
#Text=The larger the condition number was , the harder it was to compute a matrix inverse .
#Text=Hence , physical operating parameters in the in-flight model were performed by parameter normalization , details referred in .
#Text=2.2 .
#Text=Hybrid Fitting Method for Linearization
#Text=The system matrices played an important role in the steady and transient performance of the SVM .
#Text=There are commonly two ways to compute the system matrices , these being partial derivative method and fitting method .
#Text=In the former method , partial derivative in the element of system matrices is computed by perturbing one state variable , and other state variables remain unchanged .

#Text=However , in practice it is merely impossible that only one state changes while another remains unchanged by engine nature ; thus , models solved by partial derivative method lack accuracy , especially during dynamic process .
#Text=The fitting method generates the system matrices ’ elements with the object function of least square errors between the component-level model ( CLM ) and model responses to step inputs .
#Text=Choosing the perturbing amplitude and direction relies on the experiences — they closely affect to the SVM modeling accuracy .
#Text=In addition , the curve part of step response data mainly depicts the system dynamics , and the remainder of the data shows the system steady behavior .
#Text=Because the different part is processed in the same way , it is thus hard to address the steady and transient performance of the SVM at the same time .
#Text=In this paper , a hybrid fitting method was developed from the combination of partial perturbing and fitting methods .
#Text=The matrices and were related to the transient stage , whereas the matrices and related to steady stage of step response .
#Text=The initials of matrices and were obtained by the partial perturbing method , and steady-state component was used to compute the initials of matrices and .
#Text=The initials of matrices and were directly computed from the steady terminal values of one-control-variable step response by algebraic operation .

#Text=The initials of these system matrices were acquired from the above implementations , and then the fitting method was employed to obtain the optimal system matrices , which follow the least square errors .
#Text=The detailed procedure of the hybrid fitting approach is given as follows :
